story.soThat: I can use it with assistive technologies

tasks.task: Accessibility audit using testing tools (axe DevTools, WAVE, Lighthouse)
Fix keyboard navigation (all interactive elements accessible via keyboard)
Add ARIA labels and roles for screen readers
Ensure proper heading hierarchy and semantic HTML
Add text alternatives for color-coded information
Fix form labels and error messages
Test with screen readers and keyboard navigation

criterion.then: it: Meets WCAG 2.1 Level AA standards, Works with screen readers, Has keyboard navigation, Has text alternatives for colors, Has clear form labels
I can: Access all interactive elements, Navigate between sections, Submit forms, Use all features, See focus indicators
I can: Understand page structure, Navigate by headings, Understand form labels, Understand button purposes, Understand error messages
I can: Understand all information without relying on color alone, See text alternatives for color-coded information, Distinguish interactive elements

doc.title: Epic Breakdown
doc.snippet: As a user with disabilities, I want the application to be accessible, So that I can use it with assistive technologies. WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance, keyboard navigation, screen reader support, color contrast.

doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance required. Support for screen readers, keyboard navigation, color contrast, text alternatives.

artifact.reason: Button component. Ensure proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, focus indicators.
Input component. Ensure proper labels, ARIA attributes, error message associations.

constraints.constraint: WCAG compliance: Meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA standards
Keyboard navigation: All interactive elements accessible via keyboard, visible focus indicators
Screen reader support: Proper ARIA labels, roles, semantic HTML, heading hierarchy
Color contrast: Sufficient color contrast ratios (4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for UI components)
Text alternatives: Text alternatives for color-coded information, icons, images
Form accessibility: Proper labels, error message associations, required field indicators

interface.name: Accessibility Testing Tools
interface.signature: Use accessibility testing tools: - axe DevTools (browser extension) - WAVE (Web Accessibility Evaluation Tool) - Lighthouse (Chrome DevTools) - Screen readers (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) - Keyboard navigation testing

tests.standards: Testing approach: Accessibility audits, keyboard navigation tests, screen reader tests, color contrast tests. Focus on WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance, keyboard accessibility, screen reader compatibility, and color contrast. Test edge cases: all interactive elements, all forms, all pages, color-coded information. Manual testing with screen readers and keyboard navigation.
tests.locations: Accessibility audits: Use axe DevTools, WAVE, Lighthouse for automated testing Keyboard navigation tests: Test all interactive elements via keyboard Screen reader tests: Test with NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver Color contrast tests: Verify color contrast ratios meet WCAG standards No formal test framework currently configured - focus on manual testing and code review

test.steps: 1. Navigate application with assistive technologies. 2. Verify meets WCAG 2.1 Level AA. 3. Verify works with screen readers. 4. Verify keyboard navigation works. 5. Verify text alternatives for colors. 6. Verify clear form labels.

1. Navigate using only keyboard. 2. Verify can access all interactive elements. 3. Verify can navigate between sections. 4. Verify can submit forms. 5. Verify can use all features. 6. Verify focus indicators visible.

1. Navigate with screen reader. 2. Verify understand page structure. 3. Verify can navigate by headings. 4. Verify understand form labels. 5. Verify understand button purposes. 6. Verify understand error messages.

1. View application with color vision deficiency. 2. Verify understand all information without relying on color alone. 3. Verify text alternatives for color-coded information. 4. Verify can distinguish interactive elements.
